overview: The Mortgage Rescue Scheme can help if you can't make mortgage repayments and are in danger of becoming homeless - what you'll get, eligibility and applying
title: Mortgage Rescue Scheme

table.body:
The Mortgage Rescue Scheme can help if you're having difficulties making your mortgage repayments and are in danger of becoming homeless.

It's a last resort after you've tried all other options to make your repayments easier - talk to your lender first. 

If you're eligible you could get financial help to stay in your home. You apply through your local council. 

^The scheme is only available in England. If you're in Scotland, Wales or Northern Ireland, [contact your local council](http://local.direct.gov.uk/LDGRedirect/Start.do?mode=1 "contact your local council"){:rel="external"} to find out about similar schemes.^
table.title: Overview

table.body:
When you apply:

- the council will arrange for you to meet a money adviser if you haven't already
- they may also arrange an assessment of your home
- you'll get advice and a plan to help you manage your debt

##Financial help

There are 2 kinds of financial help. With both, the council involves a Registered Social Landlord (RSL). This is an independent housing organisation.

###Equity loan

The RSL provides an interest-only loan to help pay off some of your mortgage and reduce payments to an affordable level. You need no more than 40% equity in your property to qualify for this. 

###Government mortgage to rent

The RSL buys your home for 90% of its market value. You'll stay in your home and pay rent to the RSL. The rent will be 20% less than the market rate for your area.

*[RSL]: Registered Social Landlord
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
Someone in your household must be in 'priority need'. This could be:

- a pregnant woman
- someone with dependent children
- someone who is vulnerable because of old age or a physical or mental impairment

There are also the following criteria:

- your household earns less than £60,000 a year
- you don't own a second home, including abroad
- the value of your mortgage (and any loans taken out against your home) is less than 120% of the value of your home
- the value of your home isn't higher than the level set for your region (ask your council about this)

^There are other criteria as well - [contact your local council](http://local.direct.gov.uk/LDGRedirect/Start.do?mode=1 "contact your local council"){:rel="external"} for more advice about eligibility and 'priority need'.^
table.title: Eligibility

table.body: Apply for help through the scheme through your [local council.](http://local.direct.gov.uk/LDGRedirect/Start.do?mode=1 "contact your local council"){:rel="external"}
